name: 10 Questions about 2002 World Cup Qualifiers | Sports

questions.text: Which of the following countries did not qualify for World Cup 2002?
questions.explanation:
Czech Republic.

	The Czech Republic failed to qualify as they were beaten by Belgium in the play-offs.

questions.text: The biggest thrashing of the World Cup qualifiers in the European section was handed out by Belgium. They won 10-1, but who were the unfortunate team on the receiving end?
questions.explanation:
San Marino.

	San Marino have 'traditionally' been the whipping boys on the European international scene. It's not surprising as the bulk of their squad play their domestic football with lower league Italian clubs.

questions.text: What was the order in which the five teams from Group 6 finished?
questions.correct: Croatia, Belgium, Scotland, Latvia, San Marino
options: Croatia, Belgium, Scotland, San Marino, Latvia
Belgium, Croatia, Scotland, Latvia, San Marino
Belgium, Croatia, Latvia, Scotland, San Marino
questions.explanation:
Croatia, Belgium, Scotland, Latvia, San Marino.

	Croatia had 18 points and won the group. Belgium has 17 points and went into the play-offs where they qualified. Scotland (15) Latvia (4) and San Marino (1), failed to qualify.

questions.text: Which country had the highest goal total at the end of the group matches?
questions.explanation:
Portugal.

	Portugal had 33, both Germany and Italy had 16. Belarus had 12.

questions.text: Who was the first Englishman to score in the qualifiers?
questions.explanation:
Gary Neville.

	Gary Neville was the first to score, in England's third game of the qualifiers against Finland at home. Unfortunately, it was an own goal. Michael Owen was the first Englishman to net at the correct end, when he equalised in the same game.

questions.text: Which was the only team that failed to score a single goal throughout the qualifying matches?
questions.explanation:
Liechtenstein.

	Liechtenstein scored 0 and conceded 23 from their eight matches.

questions.text: Including the play-offs and the group matches: which was the only team to beat the Republic Of Ireland?
questions.explanation:
Iran.

	Iran beat them 1-0 in the 2nd leg of the play-offs.

questions.text: Who did Turkey beat 6-0 on aggregate in the play-offs?
questions.explanation:
Austria.

	Turkey beat Austria 5-0 at home and 1-0 away.

questions.text: How many countries from Europe qualified for the 2002 World Cup?
questions.explanation:
15.

	France, England, Croatia, Denmark, Germany, Belgium, Turkey, Slovenia, Russia, Italy, Poland, Spain, Republic Of Ireland, Portugal, and Sweden.

questions.text: Which Italian scored three braces for his country during the qualifiers?
questions.explanation:
Fillipo Inzaghi.

	He scored them against Lithuania, Romania and Hungary.
